p: Surinamensin is a natural neolignan isolated from the leaves of V. surinamensis, whose activity against Leishmania donovani amastigotes and promastigotes was tested in vitro based on its anti-schistosomal activity [ 27]. Steroids, lignans, flavonoids, and polyketides were also isolated from V. surinamensis [ 27]. The results revealed that surinamensin is active against L. donovani promastigotes but showed no selective toxicity when tested against the amastigotes in the mouse peritoneal macrophage model [ 28]. Besides, the 8. O.4′-neolignan 3,4,5-trimethoxy-8[3′,5′-dimethoxy-4′-propenylphenoxy]-phenylpropane was isolated from Virola pavonis, and it showed in vitro anti- L. donovani promastigote activity at 100 μM in an assay using extracellular promastigotes [ 28].
